data.title: Tania Bruguera: Talking to Power / Hablándole al Poder
data.meta_description: A survey exhibition that presents all of Bruguera’s long-term, socially engaged art projects to date.
data.text:
Catalogue for Talking to Power / Hablándole al Poder

Edited with text by Lucía Sanromán, Susie Kantor.

Talking to Power / Hablándole al Poder surveys Bruguera’s artworks for the public sphere created between 1985 and 2017, all of which position art as a resource for social change. This collection of works offers the reader a deep understanding of the artist’s strategies for intervening in power. Richly illustrated and including rarely seen documentation of Bruguera’s actions, this volume features texts by José Luis Falconi, Grant Kester, Suzanne Lacy, Cuauhtémoc Medina and Peggy Phelan.

Tania Bruguera: Talking to Power / Hablándole al Poder is organized by Yerba Buena Center for the Arts and curated by Lucía Sanromán, director of visual arts, and Susie Kantor, curatorial associate. The exhibition is supported, in part, by the Alvarez Family Foundation and The Growlery. Additional support is provided by Changing the Ratio: Female Artists at YBCA Circle of Advisors Berit Ashla, Diana Cohn, Rekha Patel, and Catalina Ruiz-Healy and Jonathan Kevles.

Escuela de Arte Útil, a commissioned art project for the exhibition Tania Bruguera: Talking to Power / Hablándole al Poder, is organized in collaboration with YBCA Fellows, California College of the Arts, San Francisco Art Institute, the University of California, Berkeley, San Francisco State University, and the Asociación de Arte Útil.

Yerba Buena Center for the Arts is grateful to the City of San Francisco for its ongoing support.

YBCA Exhibitions 17–18 are made possible in part by: The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Meridee Moore and Kevin King, and United Airlines.

Free First Tuesdays underwritten by Directors Forum Members.
